Name: Parking Rules Summonses, Sheriff Prohibited
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to prohibiting the City Sheriff from issuing summonses for any violation of the parking rules.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section one. Section 1032 of the Charter of the City of New York is amended to read as follows:
	Section 1032. Functions, powers and duties. Except as otherwise provided by law, the functions, powers and duties formerly exercised by the sheriffs of the several counties shall remain with the city sheriff. Notwithstanding any law or provision of the charter to the contrary, the powers of the city sheriff shall not include the enforcement of parking rules and regulations nor the issuance of summonses for any violation thereof.
Referred to the Committee on Transportation.





_______
Note: Matter in italics is new; matter in brackets [ ] to be omitted.
